solution.text:
Length\(_{j}_ft\), Breadth\(=_{k}_ft\), Height\(=_{l}_ft\)
Surface area of bathroom floor\(=Length \times Breadth\)
\(=_{j}_ \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{{j*k}}_ sq.ft.\)
Surface area of a single tile\(=1 \times 1 = 1 sq.ft.\)
Therefore, no. of tiles required \(= \frac{Surface\,area\,of\,the\,floor}{Surface\,area\,of\,a\,single\,tile}\)
\(=\frac{_{{j*k}}_}{1}=_{{j*k}}_\) tiles

content.text:
The length, breadth and height of a bathroom are \(_{j}_ft\), \(_{k}_ft\) and \(_{l}_ft\) respectively. Karan wants to renovate his bathroom by installing glass panes on all four walls, repaint the ceiling and fix new tiles on the floor.
How many square tiles of side \(1ft\) will he require to redo the flooring?
